alert.note: Alert for Meriwether; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 14 at 3:47AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Georgia and west central Georgia, including the following counties, in central Georgia, Bibb, Bleckley, Crawford, Crisp, Dodge, Dooly, Houston, Jones, Monroe, Peach, Pulaski, Telfair, Twiggs and Wilcox. In west central Georgia, Chattahoochee, Harris, Lamar, Macon, Marion, Meriwether, Muscogee, Pike, Schley, Stewart, Sumter, Talbot, Taylor, Troup, Upson and Webster. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A stalled boundary over south-central Georgia will create an environment conducive to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
